## Z scores

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(25, mean = 5, sd = 4)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)

z_scores = function(x) {
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
}

z_scores(x = x_vec)

y_vec = rnorm(40, mean = 12, sd = 0.3)

z_scores(y_vec)

```

What else can we do?

```{r, error = T}
z_scores(3)
```

NA?

```{r, error = T}
z_scores(c("my", "name", "is", "rose"))
```

Error!

```{r, error = T}
z_scores(mtcars)
```

MANY errors!!!

Let's try again

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 values")
  }
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
}
```

## Mutiple outputs

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 values")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  output_df = 
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  
  return(output_df)
}

mean_and_sd(x_vec)
mean_and_sd(y_vec)
```

## Different sample sizes, means, sds

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, mean = 2, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarise(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

Write a function that simulates data, computes mean and sd

```{r, error = T}
sim_mean_sd = function(n, mu, sigma) {
  
  #do checks on inputs
  
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarise(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
#shift + ctrl to select multiple lines!!!
}

sim_mean_sd(30, 4, 3)

sim_mean_sd(30)
#wont work

sim_mean_sd = function(n, mu = 4, sigma = 3) {
  
  #do checks on inputs
  
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarise(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
}

sim_mean_sd(30)
#now it will

sim_mean_sd(30, 40, 3)
#can still specify a value. Using positional matching
```
